verses.kjv: Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! add ye year to year; let them kill sacrifices.
verses.web: Woe to Ariel! Ariel, the city where David encamped! Add year to year; let the feasts come around;
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for Ariel — Ariel, the city where David made his home! Go ahead, let another year pass. Let the festivals continue their cycle.

verses.kjv: Yet I will distress Ariel, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow: and it shall be unto me as Ariel.
verses.web: then I will distress Ariel, and there will be mourning and lamentation. She shall be to me as an altar hearth.
verses.ct: But I will bring distress on Ariel. There will be mourning and grief, and the whole city will become like a burning altar to me.

verses.kjv: And I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee.
verses.web: I will encamp against you all around you, and will lay siege against you with posted troops. I will raise siege works against you.
verses.ct: "I will surround you on every side and lay siege against you. I will set up siege towers and build ramps against your walls."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.
verses.web: You will be brought down, and will speak out of the ground. Your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will be as of one who has a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and your speech will whisper out of the dust.
verses.ct: You will be brought so low that your voice will come up from the ground itself. Your words will be muffled by the dust. Like a ghost whispering from the earth, your speech will barely rise above the dirt.

verses.kjv: Moreover the multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones shall be as chaff that passeth away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.
verses.web: But the multitude of your foes will be like fine dust, and the multitude of the ruthless ones like chaff that blows away. Yes, it will be in an instant, suddenly.
verses.ct: But then — suddenly, in an instant — the hordes of your enemies will scatter like fine dust, and your ruthless attackers will blow away like chaff in the wind.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be visited of the LORD of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of devouring fire.
verses.web: She will be visited by LORD of Armies with thunder, with earthquake, with great noise, with whirlwind and storm, and with the flame of a devouring fire.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts will strike with thunder, earthquake, and deafening noise — with windstorm, tempest, and flames of consuming fire.

verses.kjv: And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her munition, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.
verses.web: The multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all who fight against her and her stronghold, and who distress her, will be like a dream, a vision of the night.
verses.ct: All the nations that wage war against Ariel — every army that attacks her stronghold and brings her distress — will vanish like a dream, like a vision in the night.

verses.kjv: It shall even be as when an hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth; but he awaketh, and his soul is empty: or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite: so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion.
verses.web: It will be like when a hungry man dreams, and behold, he eats; but he awakes, and his hunger isn’t satisfied; or like when a thirsty man dreams, and behold, he drinks; but he awakes, and behold, he is faint, and he is still thirsty. The multitude of all the nations that fight against Mount Zion will be like that.
verses.ct: It will be like a starving man who dreams he's eating, but wakes up still hungry. Or like a thirsty man who dreams he's drinking, but wakes up parched and weak. That's what will happen to all the nations that fight against Mount Zion.

verses.kjv: Stay yourselves, and wonder; cry ye out, and cry: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
verses.web: Pause and wonder! Blind yourselves and be blind! They are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
verses.ct: Stop and be stunned! Go ahead, blind yourselves and stay blind! These people stumble around like drunks — but it's not from wine. They stagger — but not from strong drink.

verses.kjv: For the LORD hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers, the seers hath he covered.
verses.web: For LORD has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep, and has closed your eyes, the prophets; and he has covered your heads, the seers.
verses.ct: The LORD has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep. He has shut the eyes of your prophets and covered the heads of your seers.

verses.kjv: And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed:
verses.web: All vision has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one who is educated, saying, “Read this, please;” and he says, “I can’t, for it is sealed;”
verses.ct: Every vision has become to you like the words of a sealed scroll. When someone hands it to an educated person and says, "Please read this," he answers, "I can't — it's sealed."

verses.kjv: And the book is delivered to him that is not learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I am not learned.
verses.web: and the book is delivered to one who is not educated, saying, “Read this, please;” and he says, “I can’t read.”
verses.ct: And when the scroll is handed to someone who can't read, and they're told, "Please read this," he answers, "I don't know how to read."

verses.kjv: Wherefore the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people draw near me with their mouth, and with their lips do honour me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men:
verses.web: The Lord said, “Because this people draws near with their mouth and honors me with their lips, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;
verses.ct: The Lord said, "These people come close to me with their words and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me. Their fear of me is nothing more than rules taught by people.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.
verses.web: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, even a marvelous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden.”
verses.ct: Because of this, watch — I am going to do something astonishing among these people, something truly marvelous and shocking. The wisdom of their wise will collapse, and the insight of their sharpest minds will disappear."

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the LORD, and their works are in the dark, and they say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?
verses.web: Woe to those who deeply hide their counsel from LORD, and whose deeds are in the dark, and who say, “Who sees us?” and “Who knows us?”
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who go to great lengths to hide their plans from the LORD, who do their work in the dark and say, "Who sees us? Who will ever know?"

verses.kjv: Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter’s clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding?
verses.web: You turn things upside down! Should the potter be thought to be like clay; that the thing made should say about him who made it, “He didn’t make me;” or the thing formed say of him who formed it, “He has no understanding?”
verses.ct: How you twist everything upside down! Should the potter be treated as equal to the clay? Should something that was made say about its maker, "He didn't make me"? Should something that was formed say about the one who shaped it, "He doesn't understand anything"?

verses.kjv: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?
verses.web: Isn’t it yet a very little while, and Lebanon will be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field will be regarded as a forest?
verses.ct: In just a little while, Lebanon will become a lush, fertile field, and what is now a fertile field will seem like a dense forest.

verses.kjv: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.
verses.web: In that day, the deaf will hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind will see out of obscurity and out of darkness.
verses.ct: On that day, the deaf will hear the words of the scroll, and the eyes of the blind will see through the gloom and darkness.

verses.kjv: The meek also shall increase their joy in the LORD, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.web: The humble also will increase their joy in LORD, and the poor among men will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: The humble will find even greater joy in the LORD, and the poorest of people will celebrate because of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off:
verses.web: For the ruthless is brought to nothing, and the scoffer ceases, and all those who are alert to do evil are cut off—
verses.ct: The ruthless will be gone, the mockers will disappear, and everyone who stays up scheming to do evil will be cut off —

verses.kjv: That make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.
verses.web: who cause a person to be indicted by a word, and lay a snare for the arbiter in the gate, and who deprive the innocent of justice with false testimony.
verses.ct: those who condemn a person over a single word, who set traps for anyone who speaks up for justice at the city gate, and who use lies to cheat the innocent out of their rights.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.
verses.web: Therefore LORD, who redeemed Abraham, says concerning the house of Jacob: “Jacob shall no longer be ashamed, neither shall his face grow pale.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, says about the house of Jacob: "Jacob will no longer be ashamed, and his face will no longer grow pale with fear.

verses.kjv: But when he seeth his children, the work of mine hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.
verses.web: But when he sees his children, the work of my hands, in the middle of him, they will sanctify my name. Yes, they will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel.
verses.ct: When he sees his children around him — the work of my hands — they will honor my name. They will honor the Holy One of Jacob and stand in fear of the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.
verses.web: They also who err in spirit will come to understanding, and those who grumble will receive instruction.”
verses.ct: Those who wandered in confusion will gain understanding, and those who complained will accept instruction."
